intro: Scilla subtriphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scilla, is a bulbous perennial plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its grass-like leaves and clusters of bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and prefers well-drained, sandy or gravelly soils. It is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Scilla subtriphylla is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and ease of cultivation.
